column2: Retrieve a gift from Sayida the Sly in Istan.
Then, in Fields of Ruin: Find the southernmost point, where one is closest to the sands beyond.
Then, in Drytop: Far to the southwest, high in the sky, there is a place to see both Zephyrite past and future.
Can be refined into piles of lucent crystals.
Defeat a boss in the Queen's Gauntlet arena in the Crown Pavilion.
Extinguished the Effigy with Water Balloons
Gain a mount skin of your choice from the Black Lion Stables. Right-click to preview available mount skins.

Koss on Koss, Volume Two: Life after the Cave

Author's Note: After the success of Koss on Koss, my publisher talked me into writing a sequel. Who am I to refuse? Keep in mind: work in progress.

First Day, 1094 AE

Today I begin a new chapter of my afterlife. At long last, Palawa Joko is dead—and I'm free to leave the prison I've made for myself.

But as I emerge from that infernal cave for the first time in centuries, I find myself hesitating. So many years have passed—the world I left behind has moved on without me. What if there's no longer a place for an old warrior like me?

No, I can't think that way. There will always be a need for Koss. I need to focus on helping those who need it, and on rebuilding the Sunspears.

And my family. Melonni, my children. Tahlkora. I have to find out what happened to them. This is my new purpose.
Activates a mistonium node in your home instance.
First, in Drytop: Look out over a fallen people...
Then, in Dredgehaunt Cliffs: Deep in the mountain, steel scores deep into stone.
First, in Dredgehaunt Cliffs: Find warmth at a hearth close to Hoelbrak.
The flame effigy appears during a bonus event upon completing a successful treasure hunt.
You cannot use this while swimming.
Fire a seeking projectile that explodes upon contact and damages enemies.
Then, in Drytop: Deep underground, a light shines bright as the sun.
A small packet of vegetable seeds. This could help feed hungry villagers in Yatendi.
Old, unused supplies for the forge. Bring these to the cache by the barracks entrance.
<c=@flavor>You shouldn't eat this, but it might be good for something.</c>
Double-click to apply this to a gathering tool.
You must be level 80 to use this item.
Use water balloons scattered around the top of the Labyrinthine Cliffs to extinguish the flame effigy.
Then, in Fields of Ruin: At the top of an abandoned mine, discover precarious pillars of steel...
+10%% Maximum Health; heal for 5%% of your maximum health after blocking an attack. (Cooldown: 1 Second)
Finally, in Drytop: The ghost returns to the crash site, ready to imbue the power of her people into an Oiled Orichalcum Sword Blade...
This will change the appearance of your mount and unlock this mount skin for all characters on your account. Mounts must be unlocked before mount skins can be applied.
<c=@flavor>Too soon? Or too fast and too fun?</c>
Consuming this item will grant you one random mount skin from the Black Lion Stables.
Finish %num2% festival race[s] in the Labyrinthine Cliffs or Crown Pavilion.
Recover the cursed treasure to the south.
Can be traded with vendors in Jahai Bluffs or consumed for volatile magic.
Fire a projectile that explodes upon impact and damages enemies.
Unlocks the recipe to craft Anima.

Used to chop down all saplings.

Grants a chance to receive bonus harvesting materials in addition to your gathering results. Material types are determined by your character level and location in the world.
Channel the power of the storm!
Plunder 25 bundles of loot during the Labyrinthine Cliffs treasure hunt.
Retrieve a gift from Zalambur in his office at the Grand Sahil.
